channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Chaos erupts at GOP lawmaker's town hall after left-wing groups promote protests
item.description: Rep. Mike Flood contended with a chaotic town hall on Tuesday night as Democratic groups touted their presence on site.

item.title: Democrats Who Ignored Biden’s ‘Aggressive’ Tax Avoidance Act Outraged Dr. Oz May Have Underpaid

item.title: ‘Judicial Coup’ Threatens To Kneecap Trump’s America First Agenda
item.description: The United States is facing what El Salvador's President Nayib Bukele described as a "judicial coup."

item.title: JD Vance recalls his wife texting him under table at Silicon Valley dinner: 'These people are f---ing crazy'
item.description: Vice President JD Vance recalled what a tech CEO told him at a dinner event, years ago, and noted that his wife texted him under the table.

item.title: Mahmoud Khalil blames 'anti-Palestinian racism' for arrest in first statement since ICE detainment
item.description: The Columbia University activist arrested by federal immigration authorities earlier this month released a statement blaming "anti-Palestinian" racism...

item.title: An Unwelcome Fight Over Obeying Court Orders
item.description: Even the righteous cause of deporting brutal Venezuelan gangs should not tempt the executive branch to undermine the legitimate role of courts.

item.title: Trump’s tariffs and policies are putting America’s economy at risk: Consumer Technology Association CEO
item.description: Higher tariffs are already creating “cost shocks” for businesses, which for many will be passed on to consumers.

item.title: West Virginia, Wyoming Secure Elections With Ranked-Choice Voting Prohibitions
item.description: GOP governors of West Virginia and Wyoming signed bills on Tuesday prohibiting the use of ranked-choice voting in their states' elections.

item.title: Reporter's Notebook: Should the House allow members of Congress to vote remotely?
item.description: Debate over representatives voting in person or remotely is one that has been debated for recent years, especially after the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: From bartering ice cream for meals to a $125M business: How Jeni’s founder launched her sweet treat empire
item.description: Jeni Britton, founder of Jeni's Splendid Ice Creams, turned a $40,000 loan into a $125 million business.

item.title: Milei Isn’t Out of the Woods Yet

item.title: Ending All Visas For Chinese Students Could Send Them Into The Arms Of The CCP

item.title: The Visitor Mocks the Illegal-Immigration Craze

item.title: We Must Restore the U.S. Agency for Global Media, Not Eliminate It
item.description: Repressive regimes have failed to block the agency’s promotion of freedom around the world. Doing so ourselves could have drastic consequences.

item.title: Why Goldman Sachs’ CIO is taking a measured approach to rolling out AI across the business
item.description: Half of the 46,000 employees at Goldman Sachs have access to AI, and CIO Marco Argenti expects more will tap into the technology this year.

item.title: Florida man arrested for threatening Trump on social media
item.description: A Florida man was arrested Monday after vowing to physically harm President Trump.

item.description: The president’s legal position that he can proceed with no input from Congress or judicial review is on shaky ground.

item.title: America Has Lost The Art Of Cursing
item.description: Our lazy overuse of curse words has destroyed a tool with which we can shock listeners at appropriate moments.

item.title: The Alternative View: 401(k) Plans Are Better off Without Private Investments
item.description: The debate over the inclusion of private investments in 401(k) plans is a hot topic. Are DC plans better off without them?
